8 Nov 2019

Population Genetics/Genomics

We are interested in developing efficient and effective frameworks for studying population genomic process. A large part of our research is focused on developing such frameworks using new bioinformatics tools and pipelines.
Check out our R package, GppFst for conducting Bayesian posterior predictive simulations of population genetic statistics for inferring selection. We have also developed ThetaMater for fast estimation of effective population size from genomic data. Also, see our recent overview of current methods for inferring introgression from population genomic data
Working with collaborators, we have applied these tools to study population genomic processes in a variety of cool systems, including buzztails (i.e., rattlesnakes) and central American Boa constrictors

Stay tuned for more!
